metadata.dc:title: Testicular cancer and cryptorchidism: myth or reality
metadata.dc:description: Objective. To evaluate the previous history of cryptorchidism in patients with testicular cancer. Materials and methods. We carried out a study using 175 patients diagnosed with testicular cancer, in our hospital, from 1999 to 2010. We analyzed the previous history of cryptorchidism and its characteristics, testicular placing, histology and intervention age. Results. 5 out of the 175 patients (2,8%) with testicular neoplasm presented a history of cryptorchidism, The average age was 31 years old, an orchidopexy was only carried out in 2 patients. The histology (..) (AU)
